text:

LOL. I see. I don't come for the downvotes from Millennial Reddit children, but it comes with the territory. Say anything even remotely based in reality, and you'll be downvoted into oblivion. 

Especially if it uncovers the slimy truth behind cocksucker gays, degenerate minorities, mentally ill trannies, or any others of their rainbow unicorn "morally superior" pet groups.

Queer has different connotations for everyone, of course. To me queer means everyone that isn't heterosexual or just doesn't "fit in" in the normal spectrum of sexuality.

I guess that can vary from person to person, like faggot being a slur for some while it isn't for others.

"Does this mean I can start calling you a faggot?"

smh...

> In this case, nigger is generally accepted to be a racist slur, while nigga is adopted as a way to say “bro”, but with profanity. I cant tell you why it turned out this way, but only that it did.

Probably a way for blacks to reclaim the term in order to render it less powerful.  Much like the way the LGBT community has adopted the term queer, which also used to be primarily a slur

Ok, look, I'm a feminist and all. And I wanna agree with you, because outside of the conversation on porn I agree, I'd be disgusted by someone calling a trans person a tranny or shemale. But at the same time, as someone who identifies as a genderqueer femboy, I know plenty of trans women who, in the context of sex, use words like ladyboy and trap and even shemale to describe themselves. So is this really the right place to language police? Would anyone who is bigoted against trans people even be here?

Mine are:
- When in doubt, wear a condom
- be a proud faggot
- know what drag racing is (it will clarify quite a bit of the internet)
- don't be ashamed of who you are
- when the word conversion gets brought up, run 
- you are your biggest self advocate
